companies.name: New York, Chicago & St. Louis Railroad
New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad

privates.name: Cooking the Books
privates.description: Your accountant is creative! Money from the company often finds its way to the president. At the start of the OR, pay $___ from the company treasury to its president

privates.name: George Hudson
privates.description: You have hired the English railway financier George Hudson. He was famous for his methods to pay out capital instead of earnings. This private closes when the owning company withholds for the first time. When the owning company withholds, it is allowed to pay out from its treasury equal to the amount required to move right on the stockchart.

privates.name: Bent Track Inventor
privates.description: You have managed to find an engineer which is able to turn track after passing a station! This allows the owning company to lay an extra yellow tile. The extra yellow tile may be a gentle or sharp city. This closes the company.

privates.name: Railway Town
privates.description: Where the railroad goes, towns rise up! This private allows you to place a double-dit yellow tile on any blank hex (no city). If there is terrain cost associated with the hex, the owning company must pay it. Laying the yellow tile closes the private.

privates.name: Vanderlay Industries
privates.description: Importer/Exporter Company. This allows the owning company to start an offshore company. The offshore works like any other company, except that it has no route and thus has no requirement to own a train. However, in brown phase, it automatically connects to EITHER New York or Boston (player choice). The company then must own a train. The company is allowed to trace routes past the chosen city even if it is tokened.

privates.name: Experimental train
privates.description: You have invested in a startup train company. Like many startups, they invest more in flashy presentations than technology, and their train is very unreliable. When absorbed into a company, this gives the owning company a 2-train which runs once and then rusts (before the train buying step).

notes.note: Shares in the company treasury pay dividends to the corporation
No more than 50% of a corporation's shares may be in the market except for EMR
Shares cannot be sold of companies that have not operated

turns.name: Stock Round
steps: Buy one share or Start a new company

turns.name: Operating Round
steps: Sell stock or Issue Treasury shares
Buy any 1 stock or Start a new company
